How do many S2-specific monoclonal antib: They block the receptor binding domain (RBD).
They prevent viral entry into host cells.
What is the primary reason the S2 subuni: The S2 subunit is more conserved across variants and related coronaviruses.
The S2 subunit contains the receptor binding domain (RBD), which is crucial for viral entry.
The S2 subunit is highly variable, allowing for diverse antibody responses.
The S2 subunit is responsible for the initial attachment of the virus to host cells.
What potential advantage do nanobodies h: Their small size and stability allow them to target conserved regions effectively.
They can easily mutate to adapt to new viral variants.
They are less expensive to produce than traditional antibodies.
They can target the receptor binding domain more efficiently.
